isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: DELCO-REMY 10-SI SERIES, TYPE 116 - REPAIR PROCEDURES - REASSEMBLY

step1.para: Insert rotor shaft end (without slip rings) through the drive end frame bearing.
Fasten the rotor in a vise and position the fan, pulley and flatwasher on the rotor shaft. Install the shaft nut and tighten to 40-60 ft-lbs. (54-81 N•m).

note.para: Remember when assembling the pulley to secure the rotor in a vise only tight enough to permit tightening the shaft nut. If excessive pressure is applied against the rotor, the assembly may become distorted.

step1.para: To install the slip ring end frame assembly, remove the tape over the bearing and shaft, and make sure the shaft is perfectly clean after removing the tape.
Insert a retaining pin through the holes to hold up the brushes.
Carefully install the shaft into the slip ring end frame assembly to avoid damage to the seal.
Line up the scribed marks put on the case during disassembly and install the through bolts. Tighten until snug.
After tightening the thru-bolts remove the brush retaining pin to allow the brushes to fall down onto the slip rings.
